channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Scott Morrison eases COVID-19 restrictions on restaurants, cafes under stage one plans to kickstart Australian economy as Australian death toll stands at 97

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Australians are about to discover that a national framework does not end the confusion over what is allowed when social restrictions are eased.
item.title: Morrison's 3-step roadmap to recovery is merely a menu for the states

item.dc:creator: Hamish Hastie
item.description: Perth Airport has served breach and termination notices on several of the agreements it has with Qantas over non-payment of fees.
item.title: Qantas warns Perth Airport 'eviction notices' would see flights cancelled within a fortnight

item.description: Gardeners aren’t out on weekends mowing the lawns and trimming the shrubbery these days, writes Robin Powell.
item.title: Who says gardening has to be in the great outdoors?

item.dc:creator: Tammy Mills
item.description: Lawyers warn that employers could face serious legal trouble if they don't follow social distancing guidelines or provide hand sanitiser.
item.title: Employers could be held liable for workers who contract COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: To get a sense of how media interest in climate change has been eclipsed by COVID-19, you only need to look at the numbers.
item.title: Media data shows COVID-19 has stolen climate change's thunder

item.description: Under the deal with the provinces, Ottawa will contribute C$3 billion ($3.3 billion), representing 75 per cent of the total cost of the increased wages.
item.title: 'You deserve a raise': Canada to boost wages of essential workers

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Benji Marshall gave nothing away about his 2021 plans this week, but the prospect of bowing out at next year's World Cup alongside Sonny Bill Williams may be too great to resist.
item.title: Will Marshall be tempted by a World Cup swansong ... with SBW?

item.dc:creator: Kate Hedley
item.description: Police have released vision captured on body-worn cameras by officers making a dramatic arrest in Esperance on Thursday.
item.title: Dramatic arrest caught on camera as WA cops close in on accused man

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: REA's boss remains optimistic about the property market despite a sharp fall in listings in April, noting real estate was showing strong signs of improvement before the pandemic hit.
item.title: REA Group unveils plunge in April listings, secures $149m loan facility

item.dc:creator: Miki Perkins
item.description: A win against animal rights activists clears the way for the Victorian government to cull alpine brumbies, and increases pressue on NSW to follow suit.
item.title: Alpine brumbies to be culled after government court win

item.description: Coronavirus assessment centres have been established across Queensland.
item.title: Where to get tested for coronavirus in Queensland

item.description: Judge tells man who repeatedly raped the young woman staying at his apartment in Melbourne's CBD that his 'vile criminality' had reshaped her life.
item.title: Airbnb superhost jailed for raping 'young, vulnerable' teenager

item.description: George McBride took challenges beyond what he thought he could comfortably achieve.
item.title: Mr Fix-It in RAAF and agriculture industry

item.dc:creator: Mex Cooper
item.description: Life in lockdown for many of our readers has meant a slower pace, time with family, and small surprises and new experiences that have brought unexpected joy.
item.title: Readers find silver linings to life in lockdown

item.description: Victoria is the only state not already preparing to allow for a return to school.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Karl Quinn
item.description: The New York-based actress joins Ewen Leslie and musician John Butler in a one-off live-streamed show.
item.title: 'I just miss the theatre': Why Mrs America's Rose Byrne joined experiment

item.dc:creator: Jason Steger
item.description: The American novelist is only the fourth writer to win the Pulitzer for fiction on two occasions.
item.title: Bookmarks: Another Pulitzer for American novelist Colson Whitehead

item.dc:creator: Jake Wilson
item.description: A lovelorn showgirl, a group of eccentric dog-fanciers, Conan the Barbarian, and more.
item.title: Top five films: best of what's new in streaming

item.description: Pip Williams' brilliant novel bounces off the words excluded from the first Oxford English Dictionary.
item.title: A few words in your ear about gender, dictionaries and kindness

item.description: How different is Jacinda Ardern from other modern politicians?
item.title: What makes Jacinda Ardern such a special political presence?

item.description: James Shapiro has written a fascinating account of Americans and Shakespeare.
item.title: How the Bard fared in the land of the free and home of the brave

item.dc:creator: Sandra Hall
item.description: The director's realistic and intimate portrayals of family life are perfect for at-home viewing.
item.title: The binge-worthy films of Noah Baumbach

item.dc:creator: John Shand
item.description: Lucinda Williams' Good Souls Better Angels, Carl Orr's Somewhere Else, Brigadoon's Itch Factor and Teddy Thompson's Heartbreaker Please.
item.title: Music reviews: Lucinda Williams, Teddy Thompson, Carl Orr and more

item.description: Don Winslow is at his brilliant best in Broken.
item.title: Six stories from the brilliant and angry Don Winslow

item.dc:creator: John McDonald
item.description: A new biography-in-disguise reveals much about the complex artist's life and work.
item.title: Inside the double life of secretive painter Edouard Vuillard

item.dc:creator: Thomas Keneally
item.description: The safety nets the government has recently introduced were missing for the unemployed in the 1930s.
item.title: How the COVID-19 gloom doesn't match the dark days of the Depression

item.description: A new documentary focuses on Richard Leplastrier, one of Australia’s most preeminent architects, and his search for beauty.
item.title: Falling in love with landscape

item.description: Helen Elliott's collection of essays by grandmothers – women who have paused to reflect – is bracing.
item.title: The view from the women who may know best

item.description: As the author is recognised for services to Australian publishing, Fenella Souter considers her contribution.
item.title: What is it about Helen Garner? One reader's appreciation

item.description: James Bradley is unapologetic in describing his new novel that imagines the recreation of a Neanderthal as unconsoling.
item.title: Investigating the morality of bringing extinct species back

item.description: Shopping for food has always sparked more joy in me than any other domestic chore - now it's delivered straight to my door.
item.title: Confessions of an online grocery shopper

item.description: A man who murdered a stranger over the noise of children splashing and playing in a dam has been jailed for more than two decades.
item.title: Man jailed for 22 years after murdering stranger over noise of kids playing

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Face masks could be mandatory for passengers on all flights within Australia, but a reprieve from planes' dreaded "middle seat" could be short-lived as airlines prepare for interstate travel restrictions to ease.
item.title: Masks or eye-watering fares? Airlines prepare for COVID-19 flying

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: More than two thirds of shareholders have voted against the pay packets of AMP's executives after the wealth manager handed down a $2.5 billion loss.
item.title: Shareholders hit AMP with first strike against executive pay packets

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: The federal government will delay implementing a suite of recommendations from the banking royal commission by six months.
item.title: Government delays Hayne reforms as pandemic hits

item.dc:creator: Ronny Lerner
item.description: The AFL will not force players to have a mandatory flu vaccination ahead of the resumption of the game, instead leaving the decision up to players and club doctors.
item.title: Flu jabs will not be mandatory for AFL players, league says

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Rowan Marshall was 21 when he was drafted and learned to fend for himself while outside the football bubble.
item.title: Rising Saint backs lift in draft age

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: The future of a world-leading solar research centre whose designs power $50 billion photovoltaic systems is at risk.
item.title: 'Major blow' looms for top Sydney solar research unit as funds wither

item.dc:creator: Sam McClure
item.description: The Adelaide Crows will be cautioned by police for breaking South Australia’s coronavirus quarantine protocols.
item.title: Crows cohort set for police caution over 'honest mistake', Adelaide boss apologises to AFL

item.dc:creator: Tory Maguire
item.description: Science reporter Liam Mannix joins national editor Tory Maguire to discuss the convoluted hunt for a COVID-19 vaccination.
item.title: Please Explain podcast: the vaccine debates

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: Premier Daniel Andrews will not race to ease social distancing restrictions in Victoria after the Prime Minister released a three-stage plan to kick-start the nation.
item.title: Cautious Premier won't rush to lift Victorian restrictions

item.description: Iris Love spotted a school of dolphins (animals sacred to Aphrodite) and took it to be a good omen.
item.title: Archaeologist who discovered the Temple of Aphrodite

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Queensland’s Chief Health Officer Dr Jeannette Young says only three players are refusing to get vaccinated, and the season will be allowed to resume as planned.
item.title: NRL season to go ahead after 'misunderstanding' over player flu jabs

item.description: Kim Jong-un sent a personal message to China's Xi Jinping to congratulate him on his handling of the coronavirus outbreak.
item.title: 'Enemies remain enemies': North Korea blasts South, praises China

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Small businesses in Queensland who have missed out on state government coronavirus relief may see another injection of cash soon.
item.title: 'Swallowed up in minutes': More money for small business on the way

item.dc:creator: Darren Kane
item.description: Chinese swimmer Sun Yang's appeal to the Swiss Federal Tribunal has only five routes to success - and three of them appear irrelevant to his case.
item.title: Final appeal was as sure as the Sun rising, but will it succeed?

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: West Australians are turning to the dark web to buy an anti-malaria drug touted by US President Donald Trump as a coronavirus treatment.
item.title: ABF warns against self-medication as shipments of Trump-touted virus 'cure' soar

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Here's the full list of how and when Queensland will ease lockdown restrictions.
item.title: When Queenslanders can go to the pub, salon, pool and gym

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: It's understood the three Queensland clubs were advised by the NRL on Friday that they must stand down players who have not had a flu vaccination.
item.title: Three Titans players stood down for refusing flu shot
